page.title: 15ALL SAINTS CHURCH, BLAKENEY
page.content: This church is a 19th Century Gothic building of local forest stone. In 1877 Blakeney became a full parish, having previously been part of Awre. In 1936 it was reunited with Awre, and in 1982 Newnham was added and the Blakeney vicarage was sold. The villagers use the church for marriages, baptisms and funerals but there are only 41 on the electoral roll and the congregation is small and ageing. The P.C.C. was unable to raise its Quota in 1984. The building is in a good state of repair and decoration but the churchyard is completely overgrown. An M.S.C. scheme will clear the churchyard and restore the lych-gate in 1986 and discussions are taking place with the Awre Parish Council for the possible transfer of responsibility for the churchyard.
